A Vision for Leicester-South
My Manifesto
As your independent MP, my loyalty lies with you, not with any party or special interest group. Together, let's allow experience, knowledge, and belief to guide us.
Cost of Living Crisis
We all feel the squeeze from rising costs, exacerbated by the ongoing Ukraine conflict. The government has pledged £12 billion to Ukraine, but I believe we must reassess these payments. Instead, we should support struggling households directly, using the energy rebate model. The government should in the time of crises have powers to take radical steps to reduce the cost of staple foods.
NHS Emergency and Long Waits
The NHS has been underfunded for far too long. The NSH needs immediate investment. 16% / £15 billion of NHS expenditure is paid to private companies. It must directly employ staff resulting in quality care and savings.
Junior doctors have faced a steep decline in pay and need to have their pay restored.
This year the NHS’s antenatal care paid out £1 billion of its £3 billion budget on compensation. Providing targeted staff training is essential to professional care and savings.
Nationalisation
We must nationalise water and energy sectors to reduce bills and protect our environment. Private ownership has led to higher prices and inadequate investment in infrastructure.
Many foreign companies own parts of our energy and water. Instead, our government can own the same in favour of our economy.
Wealth Tax
A modest wealth tax on the richest 350 families could generate £20 billion. With more billionaires and food banks than ever, it's time for a fairer tax system that ensures the wealthy contribute their fair share.
Defence Spending and Security
While Labour plans to increase defence spending to £90 billion annually, we are surrounded by allies and face greater threats from cyber-attacks. Our priority should be addressing these modern threats, not escalating military spending. Leicester-South will advocate for peace and harmony with Russia, focusing on cybersecurity.
Sanctions against Russia have led to direct cost rises in the UK. British Companies are exporting hundreds of millions of millions of pounds of equipment which ends up in Russia through Uzbekistan and other countries violating official sanctions. Russian Crude oil is refined in Inda and then imported in the UK. I will argue that these companies must be taxed further for their illegal behaviour. I will in expose this equality in Parliament and demand consequences.
Gaza & International Affairs
Leicester is united in supporting Gaza from Genocide and war crimes committed by Israil They and their allies must be held accountable.
Our political leaders have followed policy not justice. We need to immediately stop arms sales to Israil.
The International Court of Justice, the ICC, the UN Security Council, the UN General Assembly and the Genova convention have all criticised Israil’s genocidal behaviour.
The Dutch Courts halted its government from selling weapons to Israel because there was a serious risk of violating internation law. We need independent legal checks on our government because our politicians cannot be trusted.
Rent and Housing Crisis
For over a decade, I’ve fought against unscrupulous landlords. We need legislation that protects tenants and ensures fair rent prices. Buildings around Leicester can be converted into affordable housing, and we should build more council and housing association homes.
Homelessness
Finland’s approach to homelessness, which saves £12,000 per person annually, can be our model. By reducing the use of social and health services and cutting mental health costs, we can find a sustainable solution.
Foster Care
As a foster carer, I understand the challenges facing the system. We must support foster carers and social workers, who work tirelessly to protect vulnerable children. With increasing demand and a decline in foster carers, it’s crucial to invest in this essential service.
Social workers spend on average 10 hours or more a week on unpaid work to keep the foster system from crashing. The safety of our children must be safeguarded.
Crime and Prevention
Our police need the freedom to use targeted stop-and-search powers without fear of unfair criticism. Investing in smart technology and reliable admin support will allow police officers to focus on street presence, deterring crime and reducing the burden on the justice system.
Stronger Employment Protection
Having represented workers for over 15 years, I know the importance of strong employment rights. We need to support trade unions and ensure fair treatment in the workplace, leading to worker satisfaction and more productive businesses.
The Immigration Problem
Immigration abuse must be tackled. As a former immigration lawyer, I have some insight into the issue and will discuss my detailed plan if elected. Current spouse visa rules are bias and in favour of the rich.
Elderly and Housing
The elderly should not have to sacrifice their homes for care. We must ensure they can pass on their property to their families. Improving care home staffing and standards is essential, as is recognising and supporting carers.
A solution is allowing carers to become more specialised and recognised to lessen the burden on nurses. These nurses can then focus on the NHS.
Mental Health and Suicide Prevention
With an average of 30 suicides annually in Leicester, investing in mental health care is crucial. Better mental health support will strengthen families, support employment, and reduce NHS and police burdens.
Student Loans
Scottish students receive support for university tuition across the UK. Our students need similar support, ensuring fair treatment for all.
GP Appointments
We need to revert to a system where patients can easily see their GPs. Prioritising patients will improve healthcare outcomes.
Two-Child Benefit Cap
Rising costs are making it harder for young families. The two-child benefit cap is unjust and must be challenged. This policy punishes innocent children and has no place in modern Britain.
Parking Tickets, PCNs, Bailiffs
I have assisted with many appeals against unreasonable PCN and bailiff charges. We must stop this practice immediately. I will take this issue to Parliament to demand fair charges and prevent exploitation by private companies and demand that Magistrates’ Court act reasonably.
Women’s Rights
I am a great supporter of women’s security and independence. I believe in common sense and facts.
Our Environment
We have a collective environmental obligation in promoting and implanting renewable energy. At the same time these policies must be gradual and not penalise the poor.
